entries: Drow Stalker. Drow Stalkers are expert hunters of sentient prey. They attack unseen, and by the time their enemies know what is happening, it is already too late, as they are hit with a barrage of poisonous arrows and flurry of blades from shadows in all directions. In the rare event that an enemy manages to flee, they are quickly overtaken by the skilled trackers, only to realize their fate is inescapable.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow stalker has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the stalker to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow stalker has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The drow stalker has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Evasive Fire
entries: After making a ranged attack, as a bonus action, the drow may move up to 15 ft. directly away from its target.

This action does not provoke an attack of opportunity even if  there was an enemy within 5 ft., so long as that enemy is also the one targeted for the ranged attack, which still has disadvantage under those circumstances.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/turn)
entries: The drow stalker deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow stalker that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the drow stalker doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drow makes two melee or ranged attack.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 10({@damage 3d6}) poison damage

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 10({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.
Description:

Ranged WeaponAttack: {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft. one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it take damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow stalker's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requirining no material components:
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

entries: Drow Scourge. Merely invoking the name of the drow scourge will cause many an otherwise brave warrior to feel a chill through their spine. Scourges are the most deadly class of drow warriors. They serve as guards for royalty but, more commonly, as a strike force that one uses to not only destroy their target, but also make a statement with the sheer brutality of the attack. Scourges operate without mercy or remorse, laying waste to all those who stand in their way.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow scourge has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow scourge to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow scourge has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the drow scourge can deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow scourge that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drow makes two attacks with its scimitar.

action.name: (Magic) Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 10({@damage 3d6}) poison damage

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 10({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.
Description:

{@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit. range 30/120 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow scourge's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spell, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights 1/day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: If an enemy makes a melee attack against the drow and misses, the drow may attempt a single counter-attack. To do so, the drow must see the attacker and be wielding a weapon.
tttt

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow rogue has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow rogue to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow rogue has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The drow rogue can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: SneakAttack (1/turn)
entries: The drow rogue deals an extra 7({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow rogue that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the drow rogue doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drow makes two ranged or two mele attacks.

action.name: Repeating light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Dagger (Thrown)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:  At will: dancing lights 1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow raider has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow
raider to sleep

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow raider has disadvantage on attack roils, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow raider's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}, +3 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Swift Strike
entries: If the drow makes a dash action in a direct line toward a creature, it may make a single melee attack against it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drow makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.
Description:

{@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit. range 30/120 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Drow raider. One of the reasons the drow have garnered so much animosity is the raids they launch on the surface, plundering settlements for riches, and taking some of those who survive the slaughter and rape as slaves.The raiders who carry out these acts are not only cold-hearted individuals, but also warriors fierce enough to destroy local resistance.VARIANT: CR 1 DROW RAIDERSIf slightly less powerful drow fighters better suit you game, their Challenge Rating can easily be reduced1 by doing the following: Lower their hit points to 3 remove their shields (reducing their AC to 15), andtake away the poison damage done with their shortdwords.

raider to sleep

If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Drow raider. One of the reasons the drow have garnered so much animosity is the raids they launch on the surface, plundering settlements for riches, and taking some of those who survive the slaughter and rape as slaves.The raiders who carry out these acts are not only cold-hearted individuals, but also warriors fierce enough to destroy local resistance.VARIANT: CR 1 DROW RAIDERSIf slightly less powerful drow fighters better suit you game, their Challenge Rating can easily be reduced1 by doing the following: Lower their hit points to 3 remove their shields (reducing their AC to 15), andtake away the poison damage done with their shortdwords.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow novice mage has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow novice mage to sleep

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow novice mage has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow novice mage's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 10}, +2 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast
the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow novice mage is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC12, +4 to hit with spell attacks).
The drow novice mage has the following spells prepared:
Cantrip (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, poison spray
1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile,

entries: Drow Novice Mage. One of the reasons drow mages are so powerful is that they have several human lifetimes to study magic. Gaining true mastery of magic for most drow mages takes a long time. It can be difficult for a drow mage to find a master because, in the true unforgiving spirit of drow society, a master might see a student as a threat to his own power or life. As such, an aspiring drow mage will spend decades working to forge (usually) his own fate

monster.name: DROW - Drow Matriarch

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow matriarch has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the matriarch to sleep

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow matriarch has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The matriarch's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The matriarch is a 10th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The drow matriarch has the following spells prepared:
1st level (4 slots): absorb elements, animal friendship, fog cloud
2nd level (3 slots): silence, spider climb, suggestion, web
3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, haste, protection from energy
4th level (3 slots): freedom of movement, otiluke's resilient sphere

action.name: Leadership (recharges after a long or short rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the matriarch can utter a special command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that she can see within 30 feet of her makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d6} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the matriarch. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the matriarch is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The matriarch makes two attacks with her shortsword.

action.name: (Enchanted) Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.
Description:

Ranged WeaponAttack: {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one creature. Hit 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Drow Matriarch. Drow have a matriarchal society. Females of noble birth must fight tooth and nail with other female. competitors to secure a place power. Sometimes this is done way of shrewd power politics. Other times, a noble female drow will have to use her own physical force to get her way.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The matriarch adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit her. So, the matriarch must see the attacked and be wielding a weapon.

legendaryHeader: The drow matriarch can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The drow matriarch regains spent legendary actions at the start of its tum.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The matriarch moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Rapier (Limit 2/Turn)
entries: The matriarch makes one attack with her rapier (or other melee weapon if disarmed).

legendary.name: Hand Crossbow (Limit 1/Turn)
entries: If the matriarch has not already fired her crossbow, she may make an attack with it.

legendary.name: Ward (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Any creature who targets the matriarch must first make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This ability doesn't protect the matriarch from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball. If the matriarch makes an attack or casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, the ward effect ends.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow diviner has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow diviner to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow diviner disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow diviner's innate spellcastin ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14} +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requirin no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow diviner is a 8th-level spellcaster.
spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14} +5 to hit
with spell attacks). The drow diviner has the following s prepared:
Cantrip (at will): guidance, spare the dying, thaumaturgy,
1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, detect poison or disease,ray of
2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, protection from poison, web
3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals (1 giant spider), dispel
4th level (2 slots): divination, evard's black tentacles

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drow diviner makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

Drow Diviner. Drow mages are often powerful in the arcane arts. However, many drow spell-weavers specialize in other forms of magic. Diviners are male drow who do not fit the bill for traditional mages, or female drow who wish to avoid the cutthroat power politics of drow society, but still seek to make a name for themselves with other magic. In many ways, they act similarly to priestesses of Lolth, but not wielding the same levels of power; personal or political. With these abilities, other drow seek out diviners as healers or what could pass for sages in their society. That said, diviners tend to have a few highly destructive magic tricks up their sleeves, just in case things do not go their way.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow assassin has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the assassin to sleep

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow assassin disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the drow assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the drow assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the drow assassin is subjected to an effect tha allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the drow assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fail.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the drow assassin deals an 17 ({@damage 5d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon atta and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target within 5 feet of an ally of the drow assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the drow assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow assassin's innate spellcastin ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drow makes up to two ranged attacks or three melee attacks, or one of each.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Enchanted Repeating Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage.
Description:

Ranged Weapon At {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one creature. {@h}9 (l{@dice d6 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage, and the must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature an action to shake it awake.

Drow Assassin. People do not fear drow assassins as much as they fear the drow scourges, due to the difference in notoriety. A lesser breed of killers would allow for a reputation of bloodshed to precede them, but drow assassins are not the most reputable humanoid killers of the Underdark, they are the deadliest. Little is known to others about these drow Occasionally, a noble will be found with their throat slit, or a party of adventurers will suddenly go missing. Drow assassins are not only careful in masking their handiwork, but will execute it with unheard of proficiency

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition prone}d, and magic can't put the drow to sleep

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom(Perception) checks that rely on sight

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the drow can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/turn)
entries: The drow deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll , or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the drow doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The Drow ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

At will: Dancing lights, Spider Climb.
1 f day each: Darkness, Faerie fire, Slow, Sleep, Misty Step.

entries: The drow makcs three shortsword attacks

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or
be {@condition poisoned} for | hour. If the saving throw fails by 7 or less,
the target is also {@condition unconscious} while poisoncd in this way. The
targct wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes
an action to shake it awake.

Drow Assassin. Drow assassins  were trained in the deepness of the underdark, under the tutelage of elite drow soldiers and mages. They can often come to the surface under their own motives or due to being contracted to dispach a kill order. They are the best in the business when it comes to silence and discretion.Cutthroat Politics.Drow politics are cutthroat and rife with intrigue. When drow work together, it is typically to destroy a common foe and ensure their own survival, and such alliances are short lived and fraught with peril.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep

The target must succeed on a dc 13 constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake
